required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparing the Efficacy and Safety of NN1250 Once Daily When Titrated Using 2 Different Algorithms in Insulin naïve Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: A Trial Comparing the Efficacy and Safety of Insulin Degludec Once Daily in Insulin naïve Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus When Titrated Using Two Different Titration Algorithms (BEGIN™: ONCE SIMPLE USE)

brief_summary.textblock: This trial is conducted in Europe and the United States of America (USA). The aim of this trial is to compare the efficacy and safety of NN1250 (insulin degludec (IDeg)) once daily in insulin naïve subjects with type 2 diabetes mellitus when titrated using two different self-titration algorithms (dose individually adjusted) in combination with metformin.

primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in HbA1c after 26 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in FPG after 26 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 0 to Week 26 + 7 days follow up
secondary_outcome.description: Corresponds to rate of AEs per 100 patient years of exposure. Severity assessed by investigator. Mild: no or transient symptoms, no interference with subject's daily activities. Moderate: marked symptoms, moderate interference with subject's daily activities. Severe: considerable interference with subject's daily activities, unacceptable. Serious AE: AE that at any dose results in any of the following: death, a life-threatening experience, in-subject hospitalization/prolongation of existing hospitalisation, persistent/significant disability/incapacity/congenital anomaly/birth defect.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 0 to Week 26 + 7 days follow up
secondary_outcome.description: Observed rate of confirmed hypoglycaemic episodes per 100 patient years of exposure (PYE). Confirmed hypoglycaemic episodes consisted of severe hypoglycaemia as well as minor hypoglycaemic episodes. Severe hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as requiring assistance to administer carbohydrate, glucagon, or other resuscitative actions. Minor hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as able to treat her/himself and plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol/L.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Nocturnal Confirmed Hypoglycaemic Episodes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 0 to Week 26 + 7 days follow up
secondary_outcome.description: Observed rate of nocturnal confirmed hypoglycaemic episodes per 100 patient years of exposure (PYE). Confirmed hypoglycaemic episodes consisted of severe hypoglycaemia as well as minor hypoglycaemic episodes. Severe hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as requiring assistance to administer carbohydrate, glucagon, or other resuscitative actions. Minor hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as able to treat her/himself and plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol/L. Nocturnal hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as occurring between 00:01 and 05:59 a.m.

intervention.description: Injected subcutaneously (under the skin) once daily. Dose individually adjusted.
Injected subcutaneously (under the skin) once daily. Dose individually adjusted in a stepwise manner.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 2 diabetes (diagnosed clinically) for at least 24 weeks prior to randomisation (Visit 2)
- Current treatment: metformin monotherapy or metformin in any combination with 1 or 2 other OADs including an insulin secretagogue (sulfonylurea or glinide), dipeptidyl peptidase IV (DPP-IV) inhibitors, alpha-glucosidase inhibitors, thiazolidinediones (TZDs) all with unchanged dosing for at least 12 weeks prior to randomisation (Visit 2)-metformin: alone or in combination (including fixed combination) must be at least 1000 mg daily
- HbA1c 7.0-10.0% (both inclusive) by central laboratory analysis
- BMI (Body Mass Index) no higher than 45.0 kg/m^2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Treatment with glucagon-like peptide 1 (GLP-1) receptor agonist within the last 12 weeks prior to Visit 2
- Suffer from a life threatening disease (e.g. cancer)
- Females of childbearing potential who are pregnant (as determined by central laboratory beta-human chorionic gonadotropin (beta-hCG), breast feeding or intend to become pregnant or are not using adequate contraceptive methods (adequate contraceptive methods as required by law or practise [for Germany, adequate contraceptive methods are: implants, injectables, combined oral contraceptives, hormonal IUD, sexual abstinence or vasectomised partner])

results_reference.citation: Philis-Tsimikas A, Brod M, Niemeyer M, Ocampo Francisco AM, Rothman J. Insulin degludec once-daily in type 2 diabetes: simple or step-wise titration (BEGIN: once simple use). Adv Ther. 2013 Jun;30(6):607-22. doi: 10.1007/s12325-013-0036-1. Epub 2013 Jun 29.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The trial was conducted at 43 sites in 4 countries: Finland (5), Germany (6), Spain (6) and United States of America (26).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects continued on metformin treatment at the pre-randomisation dose level and dosing frequency.

group.title: IDeg Simple
group.description: Insulin degludec (IDeg) was given once daily (OD) subcutaneously (approximately 8-40 hours intervals between doses) with pre-trial metformin according to simple titration algorithm: self-titration was performed once weekly based upon a single pre-breakfast self measured plasma glucose (SMPG) value measured on the day of insulin titration.

group.title: IDeg Step Wise
group.description: Insulin degludec (IDeg) was given once daily (OD) subcutaneously (approximately 8-40 hours intervals between doses) with pre-trial metformin according to step wise titration algorithm: self-titration was performed once weekly based on the lowest value of three pre-breakfast SMPG values measured on three consecutive days, the two days prior to and on the day of insulin titration.

participants_list.participants: One subject withdrew before exposure to trial drug

group.title: IDeg Simple
group.description: Insulin degludec (IDeg) was given once daily (OD) subcutaneously (approximately 8-40 hours intervals between doses) with pre-trial metformin according to simple titration algorithm: self-titration was performed once weekly based upon a single pre-breakfast self measured plasma glucose (SMPG) value measured on the day of insulin titration.

group.title: IDeg Step Wise
group.description: Insulin degludec (IDeg) was given once daily (OD) subcutaneously (approximately 8-40 hours intervals between doses) with pre-trial metformin according to step wise titration algorithm: self-titration was performed once weekly based on the lowest value of three pre-breakfast SMPG values measured on three consecutive days, the two days prior to and on the day of insulin titration.

outcome.title: Change in Glycosylated Haemoglobin (HbA1c)
outcome.description: Change from baseline in HbA1c after 26 weeks of treatment.
outcome.population: The full analysis set (FAS) included all randomised subjects and missing data was imputed using last observation carried forward (LOCF).

group.title: IDeg Simple
group.description: Insulin degludec (IDeg) was given once daily (OD) subcutaneously (approximately 8-40 hours intervals between doses) with pre-trial metformin according to simple titration algorithm: self-titration was performed once weekly based upon a single pre-breakfast self measured plasma glucose (SMPG) value measured on the day of insulin titration.

group.title: IDeg Step Wise
group.description: Insulin degludec (IDeg) was given once daily (OD) subcutaneously (approximately 8-40 hours intervals between doses) with pre-trial metformin according to step wise titration algorithm: self-titration was performed once weekly based on the lowest value of three pre-breakfast SMPG values measured on three consecutive days, the two days prior to and on the day of insulin titration.

measure.title: Change in Glycosylated Haemoglobin (HbA1c)
measure.description: Change from baseline in HbA1c after 26 weeks of treatment.
measure.population: The full analysis set (FAS) included all randomised subjects and missing data was imputed using last observation carried forward (LOCF).

outcome.title: Change in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG)
outcome.description: Change from baseline in FPG after 26 weeks of treatment.
outcome.population: The full analysis set (FAS) included all randomised subjects and missing data was imputed using last observation carried forward (LOCF). For 7 subjects baseline values were missing.

group.title: IDeg Simple
group.description: Insulin degludec (IDeg) was given once daily (OD) subcutaneously (approximately 8-40 hours intervals between doses) with pre-trial metformin according to simple titration algorithm: self-titration was performed once weekly based upon a single pre-breakfast self measured plasma glucose (SMPG) value measured on the day of insulin titration.

group.description: Insulin degludec (IDeg) was given once daily (OD) subcutaneously (approximately 8-40 hours intervals between doses) with pre-trial metformin according to step wise titration algorithm: self-titration was performed once weekly based on the lowest value of three pre-breakfast SMPG values measured on three consecutive days, the two days prior to and on the day of insulin titration.

measure.title: Change in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG)
measure.description: Change from baseline in FPG after 26 weeks of treatment.
measure.population: The full analysis set (FAS) included all randomised subjects and missing data was imputed using last observation carried forward (LOCF). For 7 subjects baseline values were missing.

outcome.title: Rate of Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: Corresponds to rate of AEs per 100 patient years of exposure. Severity assessed by investigator. Mild: no or transient symptoms, no interference with subject's daily activities. Moderate: marked symptoms, moderate interference with subject's daily activities. Severe: considerable interference with subject's daily activities, unacceptable. Serious AE: AE that at any dose results in any of the following: death, a life-threatening experience, in-subject hospitalization/prolongation of existing hospitalisation, persistent/significant disability/incapacity/congenital anomaly/birth defect.
outcome.time_frame: Week 0 to Week 26 + 7 days follow up
outcome.population: The safety analysis set included all subjects who received at least one dose of the investigational product.

group.title: IDeg Simple
group.description: Insulin degludec (IDeg) was given once daily (OD) subcutaneously (approximately 8-40 hours intervals between doses) with pre-trial metformin according to simple titration algorithm: self-titration was performed once weekly based upon a single pre-breakfast self measured plasma glucose (SMPG) value measured on the day of insulin titration.

measure.description: Corresponds to rate of AEs per 100 patient years of exposure. Severity assessed by investigator. Mild: no or transient symptoms, no interference with subject's daily activities. Moderate: marked symptoms, moderate interference with subject's daily activities. Severe: considerable interference with subject's daily activities, unacceptable. Serious AE: AE that at any dose results in any of the following: death, a life-threatening experience, in-subject hospitalization/prolongation of existing hospitalisation, persistent/significant disability/incapacity/congenital anomaly/birth defect.
measure.population: The safety analysis set included all subjects who received at least one dose of the investigational product.

outcome.title: Rate of Confirmed Hypoglycaemic Episodes
outcome.description: Observed rate of confirmed hypoglycaemic episodes per 100 patient years of exposure (PYE). Confirmed hypoglycaemic episodes consisted of severe hypoglycaemia as well as minor hypoglycaemic episodes. Severe hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as requiring assistance to administer carbohydrate, glucagon, or other resuscitative actions. Minor hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as able to treat her/himself and plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol/L.
outcome.time_frame: Week 0 to Week 26 + 7 days follow up
outcome.population: The safety analysis set included all subjects who received at least one dose of the investigational product.

Minor hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as able to treat her/himself and plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol/L.

Severe hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as requiring assistance to administer carbohydrate, glucagon, or other resuscitative actions. Minor hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as able to treat her/himself and plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol/L. Nocturnal hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as occurring between 00:01 and 05:59 a.m.

outcome.population: The safety analysis set included all subjects who received at least one dose of the investigational product.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Novo Nordisk maintains the right to be informed of any Investigator plans for publication and to review any scientific paper, presentation, communication or other information concerning the investigation described in this protocol. Any such communication must be submitted in writing to the Novo Nordisk trial manager prior to submission for comments. Comments will be given within four weeks from receipt of the planned communication.
